channel.title: [PI] Stupid connecting problem
channel.description: I just got a new no-ip so its easier for people to connect, and Iv'e already portforwarded off Utorrent, but after i put my new no-ip in client.java (client sided) and I compile, it says error? what am I doing wrong? Do I have to do something (server sided) that will let me connect?

item.title: [PI] Stupid connecting problem
item.dc:creator: @Java_Is_So_Cool Java Is So Cool
item.description:
@Java_Is_So_Cool wrote:

no, on project insanity you can connect to your no-ip as long as its online.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Stupid connecting problem
item.dc:creator: @_Haste1 #Haste
item.description:
@_Haste1 wrote:

[quote=“Liquid Magic, post:9, topic:366862”]http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,459729.0.html

Here ^[/quote]

That’s off-topic…

OnTopic; The host of the server, cannot connect via the client with the No-Ip saved in it. You’ll need to release it as MyDesiredIP.No-Ip.Biz and then when you’ve released it, change it back to 127.0.0.1 and you ans others will be able to connect

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Stupid connecting problem
item.dc:creator: @stickywicky stickywicky
item.description:
@stickywicky wrote:

[quote=“Lord Typhis, post:7, topic:366862”][quote author=stickywicky link=topic=463058.msg3388568#msg3388568 date=1288712765]
then if your server has a client you obviusly havnt changed some file that requires it changing i.e my client needed client.java and gui.java changing
[/quote]

My Project Insanity server doesn’t have a gui.java file. I have changed every single 127.0.0.1 to my no-ip in client.java.[/quote]
i ment in the client file
the client and gui . java in the folder named java if you got the same client

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Stupid connecting problem
item.dc:creator: @Lord_Typhis Lord Typhis
item.description:
@Lord_Typhis wrote:

Let me re-phrase this; Nothing is wrong with my port, I’ve checked off of portforward.com, my port is open, I heard earlier today that I connect to the localhost, (127.0.0.1) and other people connect to my no-ip? And I have had no compiling errors its just my players can’t connect.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Stupid connecting problem
item.dc:creator: @stickywicky stickywicky
item.description:
@stickywicky wrote:

i already posted in the damn utorrent section that it only works for a small numhber of people…after trying the uttorent way i looked at the cmd promt at the end it said port 43594 iis not open on outer , although you can still download

so its saying that the port isnt open so you canrtt download from that ;port
hopefully youll understand this…and possibly not use utrroent

Read full topic
